title: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX)
description: Bug 3970[preferences] UI needed to define the default line delimiters for new files (1GFIOAX) the Windows work stations are used as X terminals and to run Eclipse (since PC are cheaper than Unix boxes).
OB: When creating a new file, the line delimiter is currently determined by the value returned from System.getProperties("line.delimiter"). However, this may not always be what the user wants.
EB: When creating a new file, even if it is on a Windows system, it should have Unix line delimiters since the end product is a Unix product. There should be a UI (Preference) in the Workbench to allow users to define the line delimiter for new files. The possible values should include: Dos/Windows, Mac, Unix, and the default platform line delimiter. This UI should be provided by the Workbench to ensure consistency across all plugins.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open Eclipse on a Windows workstation.
2. Create a new file.
3. Check the line delimiter used in the new file.
